pages.title: Getting Food
pages.text: Doing all that gathering and crafting sure has made me hungry. I'll need to rely on the land for now to provide me with a meal; I can worry about farming up my own grub later, once I've got a base of operations set up.$(br2)I should start moving about to see what's on the menu.

First things first; I'll need something to cook with. Not everything edible I can find needs cooking, but for the things that do, I can fashion a quick and easy furnace out of rocks I got from before. Anything burnable will heat it.

pages.title: Meat
pages.text: There seems to be some animals around. I wouldn't mind some protein to get me through the day! Here's some choices:
pages.text2: Eating raw meat isn't very pleasant, and might even be hazardous in some cases. For now, any meat I harvest from animals should be popped into a furnace and cooked.

pages.text: This isn't the only meat I can find, of course; nearly every animal I might come across has something yummy on its bones, from the smallest frogs to the most hulking bulls. $(br2)That being said, don't expect them all to go down without a fight.$(br2)Killing animals also yields many useful byproducts like tallow, leather, wool and feathers, which all may come in handy later.

pages.title: Seafood
pages.text: There's plenty of bodies of water around; if I'm feeling pescatarian, I could always go for something more aquatic:
pages.d_t: Eels from rivers. Like to bite.
pages.f_t: Piranhas from ponds and lakes. Very feisty.
pages.text2: Aside from getting the seafood myself and getting my hands dirty, I can also kick back and go fishing by making a crude fishing rod like so:

pages.text: After the fish bites the hook, I should reel in fast before it can escape.$(br2)I shouldn't expect something so hastily cobbled together to last; the fishing rod may unexpectedly break.

pages.title: Gardens
pages.text: Aside from the various roots and seeds I can find and munch on, gardens can also be found on occasion throughout the surface:
pages.a_t: Found in deserts and hot climates.
pages.b_t: Found in cold and snowy areas.
pages.c_t: Found in forested and dense biomes.
pages.d_t: Found in swampy and wet biomes, like swamps.
pages.e_t: Found in humid and tropical climates, like jungles.
pages.f_t: Found in sparser and more clear areas, like plains.
pages.text2: Breaking these gardens give me a variety of fruits and vegetables, which can either be eaten right away or turned into seeds for planting later.

pages.text: Each garden has fruits and vegetables that are acclimated to the conditions of the region in which it is found; so something like $(thing)winter squash$() wound only be found in a frost garden. Something to keep in mind when setting up farms later.$(br2)$(italics)$(#a84b0f)Tip: Breaking a garden while sneaking drops the garden itself, which can be replanted and broken later. Great for preventing inventory clutter.$()
